Posted By: Dischade (12/3/2009 1:09:37 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I don't see why everyone is complaining about this being a 3/2 for 6 mana. It's a flying creature that can effectively control an unlimited number of creatures. (Mind Control, Clone and Rite Of Replication cost 4-5 and those are easily defeated.)  
  
I used Terramorphic Expanse to bump up my landfalls and also had a Living Tsunami on deck for ensuring that I always had at least one landfall (except I lost it early grr).  
  
Add a Whispersilk Cloak and you're golden.  
  
4 of these in a deck? Good night. This is a fantastic card.  
  
5/5
posts.html:
I don't see why everyone is complaining about this being a 3/2 for 6 mana. It's a flying creature that can effectively control an unlimited number of creatures. (Mind Control, Clone and Rite Of Replication cost 4-5 and those are easily defeated.)

I used Terramorphic Expanse to bump up my landfalls and also had a Living Tsunami on deck for ensuring that I always had at least one landfall (except I lost it early grr).

Add a Whispersilk Cloak and you're golden.

4 of these in a deck? Good night. This is a fantastic card.

5/5

Emrakul is not immune.

You likely stole or disarmed any bombs they had.
  
They dont get to cast what comes out. (eldrazi abilities, phage the untouchable etc)

Posted By: Mekh (7/14/2010 11:47:14 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This is darn hard to deal with casually when I have exactly 1 removal spell ([Lingering Death](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lingering Death)) in my deck Mostly I just play a swarm of creatures. I played one opponent who was so impressed by my 12/12 tramplin' Lodestone Myr that that was what he stole on the next turn with his Roil Elemental, instead of my Broodstar. He was playing blue and green, and had one artifact in his deck. Even that wasn't out. Next turn, my 15/15 Broodstar might have felt a small bump underfoot.   
Personal stories aside, I would want this to be a little more durable if the opponent's going to get everything back when it dies.
posts.html:

Personal stories aside, I would want this to be a little more durable if the opponent's going to get everything back when it dies.
